title: I just started maining Teemo and I keep winning because the enemy jungler camps me?
body: Is it really worth hating the devil if you're falling for his trap? Everytime I get a solo kill on Teemo the enemy jungler won't leave my lane and I always kill one of the two -- then the rest of my team gets fed because my jungler has free ganks around the map. I think the hate on Teemo is a blessing at this point.

replies.body: Teemo really isnt that obnoxious anymore.. Many bruisers can deal with him pretty easily {{champion:39}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:164}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:240}}
80% of people who dislike teemo are just following the trend without any reasoning.
Then there are the top laners which I tilt.. lmao

I dislike laning against him as Jax, Trynd, and Yasuo, but after 1 item he's a pretty free kill. You just have to recognize that the entire point of his existence is to tilt you before you outscale him. If you can make it through early laning, he ends up being a nonfactor

> [{quoted}](name=SugeMinPikk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vvQ2hE7a,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2018-09-18T05:00:40.556+0000)
>
> I dislike laning against him as Jax, Trynd, and Yasuo, but after 1 item he's a pretty free kill. You just have to recognize that the entire point of his existence is to tilt you before you outscale him. If you can make it through early laning, he ends up being a nonfactor

Exactly.

But people get pent of over that 5mins and forget he's a trash champion that will lost to almost everyone after 5 mins
If you've been a top lane main long enough, then it isn't trend following, it's actual hatred

> [{quoted}](name=DarkenedAuras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vvQ2hE7a,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-09-17T23:45:23.706+0000)
>
> If you've been a top lane main long enough, then it isn't trend following, it's actual hatred

Yea i have, i was against the teemos, i was the teemo.

i've asked and had conversations with people. 80% of them don't know why they hate teemo, they're just following the trend.
Well I guess I'm in the 20% who've played against the Teemos and genuinely hated the experience above all others

> [{quoted}](name=DarkenedAuras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vvQ2hE7a,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2018-09-18T04:10:46.644+0000)
>
> Well I guess I'm in the 20% who've played against the Teemos and genuinely hated the experience above all others

Yea, like i said. 80% not 100%
Teemo gets really powerful when he get a curvebow and tall sword.
"Annoying" champions tend to bring a lot of attention to themselves. Low elo junglers also tend to gank losing lanes as if that will help them win the game. It's better to camp winning or even lanes
Bot/mid lane is definitely has more influence on the game, and wasting time dealing with a champion that has HUGE ap scaling, is just not good for the outcome.
Yeah its good strategy but try to look for the junger and ward correctly  put pressure without dying
